hints.content:
Numbers are equivalent when they represent the same place on the number line.

Let's compare each point to $\blueD{\dfrac32}$ and find the equivalent fraction.

options.alt: Two sets of rectangles sit on top of each other. The top set is made up of 4 rectangles labeled one-half. Each rectangle represents one-half of a whole. The third and fourth rectangles from the left are shifted downward. The first three rectangles from the left are shaded. The bottom set of rectangles is made up of 6 rectangles labeled one-third. Each rectangle represents one-third of a whole. The fourth, fifth, and sixth rectangles from the left are shifted downward. The first five rectangles from the left are shaded. A number line below the rectangles show tick marks above the number line from zero-halves to four-halves and tick marks below the number line  from zero-third to six-thirds. A blue point appears at three-halves. A pink point appears at five-thirds. The pink point is to the right of the blue point. !

Two sets of rectangles sit on top of each other. The top set is made up of 4 rectangles labeled one-half. Each rectangle represents one-half of a whole. The third and fourth rectangles from the left are shifted downward. The first three rectangles from the left are shaded. The bottom set of rectangles is made up of 16 rectangles labeled one-eighth. Each rectangle represents one-eighth of a whole. The last eight rectangles from the left are shifted downward. The first 11 rectangles from the left are shaded. A number line below the rectangles show tick marks above the number line from zero-halves to four-halves and tick marks below the number line  from zero-eighths to sixteen-eighths. A blue point appears at three-halves. A purple point appears at eleven-eighths. The purple point is to the left of the blue point. !

Two sets of rectangles sit on top of each other. The top set is made up of 4 rectangles labeled one-half. Each rectangle represents one-half of a whole. The third and fourth rectangles from the left are shifted downward. The first three rectangles from the left are shaded. The bottom set of rectangles is made up of 8 rectangles labeled one-fourth. Each rectangle represents one-fourth of a whole. The last 4 rectangles from the left are shifted downward. The first six rectangles from the left are shaded. A number line below the rectangles show tick marks above the number line from zero-halves to four-halves and tick marks below the number line  from zero-fourths to eight-fourths. A blue and green point appears at three-halves, which is the same as six-fourths. !

hints.content: $\greenD{M}$ is located at the same point on the number line as $\blueD{\dfrac32}$.

The following number line is equivalent to $\dfrac32$.



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line that has moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, three unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark at 1, an unlabeled tick mark, point M, an unlabeled tick mark, and an ending tick mark at 2. !

question.content:
**Which number line shows a number equivalent to $\dfrac{3}{2}$? **

[[☃ radio 2]]

choices.content: ![A number line that has moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, two unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark at 1, an unlabeled tick mark, point L, and an ending tick mark at 2.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b8ccebc4b6630153ce928e33932b1ebfbfb47cd0)

![A number line that has moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, three unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark at 1, an unlabeled tick mark, point M, an unlabeled tick mark, and an ending tick mark at 2.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/af5b32c7b7cfb46a05fecf1e7faa1ba98ea05a27)

![A number line that has moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, seven unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark at 1, two unlabeled tick marks, point N, four unlabeled tick marks, and an ending tick mark at 2.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/9649fd012bcdf7d9b9efd921134b63ef03381d41)
